channel.title: Models help Models help! im ready to pay 10$ plz help!
channel.description:
ive been working on it all the week.. and i dont know how to add my models to my cache i followed alot of tuts.. but im mot english so its hard for me to learn this kind of thing.. :/ i got a very niice models thats i really want to add.. i already hate datmaker and metasequoia :(
plz someone could help me on teamivewer ? :S its very urgent and importante plz :S

item.title: Models help Models help! im ready to pay 10$ plz help!
item.dc:creator: @cedrick cedrick
item.description:
@cedrick wrote:

my file are not mqo or dat. its model from this models link here :

http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,493245.0.html

i really dont know what to do… the creator of this models told me to do :

Download metasequioa as well as a character base which matches that of your server (i.e 317male character). Open up the character model base and import the file and match the sword in the right hand using move, rotate, and scale. Same for the shield, just on the left. As for the chest plate, I would skip it, because that requires you to weight the armor which takes time and a tutorial.
Once the sword and shield are fitted, save them in separate files (.mqo extension). Open DATmaker and import the sword file(and the shield as well). You can find simple tutorials for metasequioa and DATmaker using the search tool. I haven’t used either program in around a year and a half, sorry.

i got a bad english… so i dont really understand what he wanna mean… so plz someone could help me with teamviewer seriously plz i really want to add this models to my server

and btw im using source : Vengeance-X PVP
its a PI

Read full topic

item.title: Models help Models help! im ready to pay 10$ plz help!
item.dc:creator: @Storm_Powner Storm Powner
item.description:
@Storm_Powner wrote:

is it a .mqo file or .dat?

if .mqo open it with datmaker, an click make .dat.

now give it a name like 5.dat.

now go to you folder where your models are stored.

btw what base are you using

Read full topic
